}}</ref> Collabora has since then hired two additional employees to help develop PiTiVi.

In the past there have been several video editors available for Linux, but, they were considered difficult to use.<ref name="jono-bacon.pitivi.5JAN2010">[http://gnomejournal.org/article/79/pitivi Jono Bacon, The GNOME Journal - PiTiVi, January 5, 2010]</ref> [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] Community Manager [[Jono Bacon]] stated "Back in 2006, the video editing situation was looking far more exciting. Michael Dominik was working on the hugely exciting Diva project and Edward Hervey was working on PiTiVi. Both combined exciting technologies, being built on the formidable foundations of GTK, GNOME, GStreamer and Cairo. Diva was developed using Mono, and PiTiVi using Python. With the video buzz in the air, Michael and Edward both demoed their projects at the Villanova GUADEC to rapturous applause."<ref name="jono-bacon.pitivi.5JAN2010" />
+
In the past there have been several video editors available for [[Linux]], but, they were considered difficult to use.<ref name="jono-bacon.pitivi.5JAN2010">[http://gnomejournal.org/article/79/pitivi Jono Bacon, The GNOME Journal - PiTiVi, January 5, 2010]</ref> [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] Community Manager [[Jono Bacon]] stated "Back in 2006, the video editing situation was looking far more exciting. Michael Dominik was working on the hugely exciting Diva project and Edward Hervey was working on PiTiVi. Both combined exciting technologies, being built on the formidable foundations of [[GTK]], [[GNOME]], [[GStreamer]] and Cairo. Diva was developed using Mono, and PiTiVi using Python. With the video buzz in the air, Michael and Edward both demoed their projects at the Villanova GUADEC to rapturous applause."<ref name="jono-bacon.pitivi.5JAN2010" />
Bacon also noted that PiTiVi has taken a long time to mature: "For Edward to have created the first incarnation of PiTiVi he needed to ensure that GStreamer and GNonLin were mature and stable enough to use for his application."<ref name="jono-bacon.pitivi.5JAN2010" />
Bacon also noted that PiTiVi has taken a long time to mature: "For Edward to have created the first incarnation of PiTiVi he needed to ensure that GStreamer and GNonLin were mature and stable enough to use for his application."<ref name="jono-bacon.pitivi.5JAN2010" />
